kube_service_error: An error has occurred loading the information: {{message}}
kube_service_description_information: Below, you will find information about your Kubernetes service, and how to access it using the kubectl tool.
kube_service_description_reset: You can reset your Kubernetes cluster's configuration at any time.
kube_service_file_error: An error has occurred loading the configuration file: {{ message }}
kube_service_file_help: The kubeconfig file contains the data required by the kubectl command-line tool to communicate with a cluster's API.
kube_service_cluster_update_available: A new update is available to optimise security: (patch version)
kube_service_cluster_api_url: Kubernetes API URL for your cluster
kube_service_cluster_nodes_url: Kubernetes node URLs for your cluster
kube_service_upgrade_policy_description_: We do not recommend this choice. OVH reserves the right to update Kubernetes components or your nodes on an exceptional basis, in critical cases that limit the security of our infrastructure.

Apply ('patch version') security updates to my Kubernetes service, to guarantee service security and stability. If we cannot avoid downtime while performing a rolling update on your nodes, we will report this to you.  We advise sizing your cluster to ensure that it can be updated at any time.

Apply ('patch version') security updates to my Kubernetes service, to guarantee service security and stability. The update may result in your nodes being unavailable for a few minutes, while we perform the rolling update.
kube_service_upgrade_policy_error: Failure to change the 'upgrading policy': {{ message }}
kube_service_minor_version_upgrade: Upgrade to the next minor version
kube_service_cluster_version_not_support: Your version of Kubernetes is no longer supported. Please upgrade to a supported version.
kube_service_cluster_versions_guide: You can find more information about the versions supported in our official End-of-Support and End-of-Life policy documentation.
kube_service_installation_information: This tutorial will guide you through installing the Kubernetes Dashboard. The Kubernetes Dashboard is a web application that can be used to manage your clusters. It is maintained by the Kubernetes community.
kube_service_cluster_network_error: An error has occurred loading the network information: {{ error }}
kube_service_cluster_admission_plugins_i: For security reasons, it is not possible to disable the Node Restriction plugin.
Warning: please note that any action on Plugin Admissions involves a redeployment of your clusterâ€™s API Server.
kube_service_cluster_admission_plugins_a: Forces each new pod to download the required images each time.
kube_service_cluster_admission_plugins_n: Using the NodeRestriction admission controller plug-in limits the Node and Pod objects that a Kubelet can modify. When throttled by this admission controller, Kubelets are only allowed to modify their own API Node object and only those API Pod objects that are bound to their node.
kube_service_cluster_admission_plugins_e: An error has occurred resetting your cluster: {{ message }}
kube_service_cluster_admission_plugins_s: The Admission Plugins modification has been processed.
